TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit KerberosReceiverSecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based upon a Kerberos ticket that is received in a SOAP message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, application developers do not need to use the KerberosReceiverSecurityToken class.
There are two classes that represent security tokens that are based upon a Kerberos ticket: <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> and KerberosReceiverSecurityToken. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token is used by clients that use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token in outgoing SOAP messages, whereas the KerberosReceiverSecurityToken security token is used by a Web service that receives SOAP messages that contain the security token.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] request) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains a Kerberos ticket.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified Kerberos ticket.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For the `request` parameter, pass the Kerberos ticket that is the returned from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.GetRequest%2A> method.
This constructor generates a unique identifier of the security token and sets that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] request, string id) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains the Kerberos ticket.
A unique identifier of the security token. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified Kerberos ticket and unique identifier.

Docs.param: An array of bytes that contains the Kerberos ticket.
A unique identifier for the security token.
The URI that describes the value type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Kerberos ticket is specified in the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause keyIdentifierClause) cil managed

Docs.param: A to compare to this instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance matches the specified key identifier.
Gets the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is associated with this security token.
Docs.value: A that contains the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is associated with this security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SecurityKey property is set when the Kerberos ticket is authenticated.

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SecurityKeys property contains the symmetric session key in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken.SecurityKey%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Docs.summary: Gets the URI that describes the value type.
Gets the Windows user associated with this security token.
Docs.value: A that represents a Windows user.
